Name: Venka
Notes: New colony set up by corporation; starport under construction

Name: Harepoint
Notes: Large mining asteroid: Government ignores fact that technologies required for survival are failing.

Name: Rolk’s Fate
Notes: Governments intentionally promote piracy to undermine faction controlling starport
Tiny research outpost

Name: Aquarius
Notes: Government headed by all-female council of 12 ruling families

Name: Pelega
Notes: Small islands mainly run by the most technically qualified

Name: Thalassa
Notes: Religious schism between worshippers of “sky-striders” and denouncers of “star-daemons”. Unfortunately they also produce several desirable luxuries.

Name: The Neck
Trade Codes: Desert, Low Population, Low Tech, Poor
Notes: Ruling class rule by employing mercenaries with high-tech equipment

Name: Firaga
Notes: Government control largely revolves around collecting massive quantities of useless information

Name: Redwater
Notes: Tiny scavenger town loots materials from ancient Human civilisation

Name: Wesnoth
Notes: Planet currently involved in high-intensity internal conflict

Name: Indus
Notes: Successful mining base revolving around highly qualified, self-selecting teams

Name: The Wall
Notes: Huge orbital complex formed from several large asteroids; Major Navy base

Name: Avina
Notes: World ruled by planetary military; much tension between rulers and Imperial Navy base

Name: Lemna
Notes: Population worship arriving starships as messengers from gods
Atmosphere almost 100% methane

Name: Highport
Notes: Currently run directly by Imperial Governor due to secession attempts by previous government ten years ago. Planet is mostly extremely hot rainforest.

Name: Rolks’ Fire
Notes: Previous king replaced by weak ruler

Name: Libertas
Notes: New republic trying desperately to drag itself out of a civilisation-threatening dark age

Name: Lalande
Notes: World is run by Planetary Lord from comfort of large mansion near starport

Name: Leviathan
Trade Codes: Low Population, Low Tech, Water world
Notes: Starport is large, floating scout base; detailed survey of planet in progress.

Name: High Deeps
Trade Codes: Fluid Oceans, Ice-capped, Low Tech, Non-Industrial
Notes: Former hydrocarbon mining operation

Name: Falkner
Notes: Population intentionally eschews higher technologies
100% water surface; High concentrations of CO2

Name: Boxcars
Notes: Mining base run by patriarchal family head.

Name: Unitas
Notes: Instructions for running world delivered by computer programmed to maximise productivity
Hot, airless planet near star
Tiny long-term research outpost

Name: Deeper’s Grave
Notes: Last remnants of forgotten mining outpost

Name: Epic Shores
Notes: Survivalist cult attempting to set up colony

Name: Nova Socia
Notes: Oppressive bureaucracy consumes almost 100% of resources; Starport crippled by conflicting edicts

Name: Schar’s World
Notes: ALL SURVEYS AND LANDINGS FORBIDDEN BY IMPERIAL EDICT
Small, rocky world

Name: Drought
Notes: World ruled over by “king” who thinks Scout service is here to bring water to planet

Name: Eva Nova
Notes: Adventurers spread out from scout base, seeking rare pharmaceuticals; Sell to chemicals company. Dangerous wildlife

Name: Freeport
Notes: Recent colony set up by libertarians
